data.title: 23 Kylie Minogue facts every fan should know
data.meta_description: Get to know more about Princess of Pop Kylie Minogue! From the meaning of her name to some interesting facts about her biggest hits.
data.text:
She's got our heads Spinning Around!

Kylie Minogue has been a music icon since the 80s when she released her debut album 'Kylie'! This year alone, Kylie has narrated an episode of a Bluey spin-off, received the BRITs Global Icon Award - and if that wasn't enough, she's also released a song with Sia called 'Dance Alone' and even performed on stage with Madonna!

Despite not technically being a Brit, we've certainly adopted her as one of our own. With millions of fans around the world, and so much media coverage of the singer over the years, it can feel like you already know everything there is to know about Ms. Minogue. In honour of the pop princess and her incredible performance at BST Hyde Park in July 2024, we've compiled some of our favourite Kylie facts...

1. 'The Locomotion' was the biggest selling single of the 80s in Australia

Kylie Minogue released 'The Locomotion' as her first single in Australia, and it stayed at Number 1 for a total of seven weeks. At the end of the decade, someone did the maths and it ended up being the biggest selling single of the 1980s in Australia. Who doesn't love a bit of that Kylie classic?

WATCH: Kylie Minogue - 'Locomotion' - Official Video

2. 'I Should Be So Lucky' was written in just 40 minutes

It's one of the most catchy songs and it was written in just over half an hour. Kylie flew to the UK to meet music gurus Stock Aitken Waterman. The story goes that they forgot Kylie was coming, had nothing prepared for her to test out and put together 'I Should Be So Lucky' while they were waiting for her to arrive at the meeting.

WATCH: Kylie Minogue - 'I Should Be So Lucky'

3. Kylie's music featured in a jukebox musical named after her song

That's right! In July 2023, it was announced that theatre show I Should Be So Lucky would feature songs by the Hit Factory AND star Kylie herself digitally in the production. The show had its world premiere in November 2023 and toured the UK and Ireland until May 2024.

She said of being involved: "I’m thrilled to announce that I will be joining Stock Aitken Waterman in presenting the new musical, 'I Should Be So Lucky'! It is the music that inspired a generation (plus my first five albums!) so to have all the SAW hits in this original story will make for a compelling, funny and heartfelt show. Let’s enjoy the magic all over again!"

Show writer and director Debbie Isitt told The Oxford Magazine of Kylie's character in the show: "The concept was Kylie being bride Ella’s reflection in the mirror – playing her inner diva – her inner confidence if you like. I wanted Kylie to play a version of herself – but also to be properly integrated into the story."

4. Kylie Minogue's Glastonbury performance was the festival's most watched ever

Kylie was heartbroken when she had to cancel her Glastonbury performance in 2005 due to her breast cancer diagnosis, however 14 years later, she got to fulfil her dream. Performing on the Pyramid Stage of the iconic British music festival, her set became the most viewed ever, with millions taking to their TV screens to watch the 'Confide In Me' singer do her thing.

In 2023, Sir Elton John's performance at the iconic festival became the most watched with 7.6 million people tuning in to watch it.

WATCH: Kylie Minogue - 'Love at First Sight' (Glastonbury 2019)

5. 'Spinning Around' wasn't written for Kylie

That's right - 'Spinning Around' wasn't initially supposed to be a Kylie song. Any ideas who it was meant for? Well, you'll be surprised to know that Paula Abdul co-wrote the song and it was supposed to be her comeback single! After the album it would have featured on didn't materialise, it was handed over to Kylie.

WATCH: Kylie Minogue - 'Spinning Around' (Official Video)

6. Kylie Minogue was in Doctor Who

Back in 2007, Kylie Minogue played Astrid Peth in Doctor Who in an episode called Voyage Of The Dammed.

At the time, Kylie said: "It's an incredible thrill to be joining David (Tennant) and the entire Doctor Who production for this year's Christmas special. Doctor Who enjoys a unique history and it is going to be very exciting to be part of that."

In an interview in September 2023, Kylie admitted she'd like to reprise her role. Describing the experience as "amazing to be in such a beloved show", alongside David Tennant, Kylie hinted that she wouldn't be adverse to returning to the TV. She told Hits Radio: "I wouldn't mind if Astrid Peth came back," before whispering: "Just saying!"

7. Kylie Minogue starred in an advert to help promote Australian tourism

Proud of her native country, Kylie Minogue teamed up with Tourism Australia in 2019 for a three-minute musical advert that appeared on TV just before Queen Elizabeth's Christmas speech.

8. Kylie Minogue has an honorary doctorate

In 2011, Kylie Minogue received an honorary doctorate from Anglia Ruskin University in a ceremony in Chelmsford, Essex. Kylie was awarded the doctorate in Health Sciences, reflecting her work to promote breast cancer after going through it herself.

Her citation at the time read: "Here at Anglia Ruskin University in Chelmsford scientists in the research laboratory for The Helen Rollason Cancer Charity are currently researching blood markers that in the future might be used to identify breast cancer at an early stage. Kylie's story will serve as an inspiration to everyone involved in this work.

"Anglia Ruskin University is proud to honour her today for her amazing career as pop singer, songwriter and actress, and for her support for promoting awareness and removing the fear of breast cancer."

9. Kylie Minogue also has an OBE

Before her honorary doctorate, Kylie received an OBE from Prince Charles in 2008. The OBE was for Kylie's services to music. She took her mum and dad along to the ceremony at Buckingham Palace and wore an incredible white silk YSL dress with glittery stars.

10. Madame Tussauds have no less than four Kylie Minogue waxworks

Well, she is the Queen of Pop after all!

11. Michael Hutchence wrote a song about Kylie

Kylie Minogue dated the late singer Michael Hutchence for 18 months, and she was the inspiration behind the INXS song 'Suicide Blonde'. When Kylie dyed her short hair for a role, she told her then-boyfriend that she was going 'suicide blonde' and Michael took the phrase and turned it into a song.

WATCH: INXS - 'Suicide Blonde'

12. Kylie Minogue was great friends with the fashion designer Jean Paul Gautier

Kylie Minogue is known as a style icon, but her looks are not without an entire team behind her. Kylie forged a friendship with fashion designer Jean Paul Gautier in the early days of her career, and the pair worked together on so many of her iconic looks and tour costumes.

13. Kylie Minogue has a brother

We all know about Kylie's sister Dannii Minogue, but did you know she has a brother? Preferring to work behind the lens, Brendan is a news cameraman in Australia.

In May 2024, Kylie thanks her family, including her brother as she celebrated her 56th birthday.

14. What star sign is Kylie?

Kylie Minogue was born on the 28th May 1968, making her currently 56-years-old and a Gemini.

15. Kylie Minogue has duetted with some of the biggest names in the music industry

Kylie Minogue and Jason Donovan are one of the most well-known duos in pop culture but it's not just 'Especially For You' that has seen Kylie share the vocals - she's also dueted and performed with some seriously big names.

Rumoured to be dating once upon a time, Kylie Minogue colloborated with Nick Cave and the Bad Seeds on the song 'Where The Wild Roses Grow'. Kylie also teamed up with Enrique Iglesias for 'Beautiful', sang with Nile Rodgers and Jake Shears on 'The Other Boys', released 'Music's Too Sad Without You' with Jack Savoretti and also sang with the likes of Taio Cruz, Shaggy and Sam Sparro.

A remix of her single 'Real Groove' with Dua Lipa was released in December 2020 following the pair performing together during the Studio 2054 livestream.

More recently, Kylie released her song 'A Second To Midnight' with Years & Years in October 2021, and later released 'Kiss Of Life' with Jessie Ware in November 2021.

But one of the best Kylie duets? Kylie and Robbie Williams with the song 2000 'Kids'.

WATCH: Robbie Williams and Kylie Minogue's music video for 'Kids'

16. There's a Kylie Minogue bedding range

Kylie has turned her hand to interior design and its proven hugely popular. As well as Kylie Minogue bedding, think soft grey fabrics, velvet touches and a bit of glitz. You can also jazz up your home with Kylie Minogue curtains, cushions and wallpaper.

17. Her name has an interesting Aboriginal meaning

What do you think when you think of Kylie? Beautiful? Glam? Kind? While they're all good words to describe Kylie, her name actually means boomerang in the Aboriginal language!

18. Kylie returned to Neighbours!

Kylie starred as Charlene Robinson (née Mitchell) in the Australian soap in the 80s, and following the sad news that the show was being axed after 37 years it was announced that Kylie was coming back to appear in the finale.

She appeared in the then-final episode with her on-screen husband Scott Robinson played by former real-life flame Jason Donovan. In their original run on the show, the episode with Charlene and Scott's wedding was one of the most-watched TV moments of the decade with more than 20 million people tuning in to watch across Australia and the UK.

Speaking about being back on Neighbours, Kylie said: "It was lovely and emotional. Driving into Ramsay Street was quite something."

19. She had a residency in Las Vegas

On 28th July 2023, Kylie announced she'd landed her very own residency at the Voltaire nightclub at The Venetian in Las Vegas. Her residency has now finished, however she has said she'd like to return.

20. Kylie won a Grammy Award in 2024

Kylie's huge track 'Padam Padam' won the Grammy Award for Best Pop Dance Recording. The win was 20 years after she won the Best Dance Recording accolade in 2004 for 'Come Into My World'.

21. Kylie won the BRITs Global Icon Award in 2024

Kylie picked up the Global Icon Award at the BRIT Awards 2024. The award was in recognition of her career spanning across five decades as one of the world’s most successful and iconic music stars. The singer is the only female artist to have a Number 1 album in five consecutive decades in the UK.

22. Kylie has her own Barbie

In March 2024, Kylie was honoured with her own Barbie to celebrate International Women's Day and Barbie's 65th anniversary. Kylie's Barbie is kitted out in her 'Padam Padam' outfit.

23. Kylie performed on stage with Madonna

Not only did Kylie join Madonna on stage during her 'Celebration' tour, she also wore a top with Madonna's name on it. This was reminiscent of the iconic top Madonna worn back in 2000 to perform at the MTV Europe Music Awards in Stockholm in Sweden.
